macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Wall Street closes at fresh records after mixed U.S. jobs report
items.summary: U.S. stocks ended at new highs as the S&P 500 gained about 0.6%, the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose roughly 0.5%, and the Nasdaq Composite advanced 0.8%, after a December employment report showed weaker-than-expected hiring but an improved unemployment rate that kept prospects for Fed rate cuts this year alive.

items.title: S&P 500 extends record run, now near 6,970 level
items.summary: The S&P 500 closed around 6,966, surpassing its prior all‑time high set earlier in the week, while the Dow climbed to about 49,504 and the Nasdaq outperformed, reflecting strength in large-cap growth and tech shares despite ongoing concerns about the economic outlook.

items.title: Labor market cools but unemployment rate improves, shaping Fed expectations
items.summary: The latest U.S. jobs report showed December hiring came in below economists’ forecasts, but the unemployment rate fell more than expected, reinforcing a “low‑hire, low‑fire” labor market that suggests slower but still resilient growth and leaves room for at least one additional Fed rate cut later this year.

items.title: Treasury yields edge lower as markets weigh soft hiring and future Fed cuts
items.summary: The 10‑year U.S. Treasury yield slipped to about 4.16% from 4.19% as investors digested the mixed jobs data, with strategists noting that while the Federal Reserve appears divided, markets still expect lower policy rates over the course of the year.

items.title: Strategists see 2026 U.S. expansion continuing with modest additional Fed easing
items.summary: J.P. Morgan’s latest outlook assigns an 80% probability that the U.S. economy remains in expansion in 2026, projecting roughly 2% growth and expecting inflation to stay rangebound, which they argue should allow the Federal Reserve to maintain an easing bias and deliver at least one more rate cut this year.

items.title: Policy proposal for Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac MBS purchases seen as proxy QE
items.summary: Markets are watching a Trump administration proposal that would allow Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to buy up to $200 billion of agency mortgage‑backed securities, a move investors view as a quasi‑quantitative easing program aimed at lowering long‑term mortgage rates and supporting housing and credit conditions.

items.title: Vistra surges after long‑term nuclear power supply deal with Meta Platforms
items.summary: Shares of power producer Vistra jumped about 10.5% after the company signed a 20‑year agreement to supply electricity from three of its nuclear plants to Meta Platforms, highlighting Big Tech’s accelerating push to lock in low‑carbon power for AI‑driven data center growth.

items.title: Homebuilder and building‑products stocks rally on rate‑sensitive optimism
items.summary: Builders FirstSource surged about 12%, while major homebuilders including Lennar, D.R. Horton, and PulteGroup gained roughly 7–9%, as investors bet that stabilizing or lower long‑term rates and policy support for housing could bolster demand in the construction and homebuilding sectors.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Morgan Stanley Files for First Bitcoin and Solana Spot ETFs in Major Wall Street Crypto Push
items.summary: Morgan Stanley has filed with the U.S. SEC to launch exchange‑traded funds tracking the prices of bitcoin and solana, marking one of the most significant moves by a major U.S. bank toward regulated crypto exposure and signaling growing institutional comfort with crypto ETFs.
items.source: Metal Pay News / Reuters (cited in Metal Pay recap)

items.title: Truebit (TRU) Token Collapses 99.9% After Exploit Drains 8,535 ETH
items.summary: Truebit’s TRU token crashed about 99.9% after an attacker exploited an old smart contract to extract roughly 8,535 ETH (around $26.6 million), enabling the purchase of TRU at effectively no cost and triggering a mass sell‑off that raised new concerns about legacy contract vulnerabilities.
items.source: Metal Pay News / CoinDesk (cited in Metal Pay recap)

items.title: Goldman Sachs Analysts Say U.S. Clarity Act Is Key to Next Wave of Institutional Crypto Adoption
items.summary: Goldman Sachs analysts highlighted that regulatory improvements, particularly progress on the U.S. Clarity Act in Congress, are critical for large financial institutions to expand into tokenized assets and DeFi, arguing that a clear split of responsibilities between the SEC and CFTC could unlock substantial institutional capital.

items.title: Analysts Warn Clarity Act Must Pass in First Half of 2026 to Avoid Election‑Year Delays
items.summary: Industry reports note that the U.S. Clarity Act, which would define a regulatory framework for tokenized assets and DeFi and clarify SEC–CFTC roles, needs to be passed in the first half of 2026 to prevent midterm‑election politics from stalling critical crypto legislation and slowing institutional entry.

items.title: Crypto Market Sentiment Stays in ‘Fear’ as Altcoins Like XPR and LOAN Outperform
items.summary: Despite the Crypto Fear & Greed Index holding at a fearful 27, some altcoins have outperformed over the past week, with XPR Network up about 23.2%, LOAN Protocol up 21.9%, and XRP gaining 9%, while Metal‑ecosystem tokens METAL and MTL rose roughly 8.5–8.6% amid choppy ETF‑driven flows.

items.title: Early‑2026 Rotation Sees Investors Stay Bullish on Bitcoin While Backing $28M ‘Upstart’ Project
items.summary: A market commentary notes that investors remain broadly bullish on medium‑term bitcoin price prospects but that early‑2026 flows show a rotation into a smaller $28 million‑cap project, reflecting growing appetite for higher‑risk altcoin opportunities alongside blue‑chip crypto exposure.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: MIT and Microsoft unveil CleaveNet AI system for ultra-early disease detection
items.summary: Researchers at MIT and Microsoft developed **CleaveNet**, an AI model that designs peptide-based molecular sensors to detect subtle enzyme activity associated with diseases like cancer, enabling earlier diagnosis and more targeted drugs or imaging agents with fewer side effects.[3][4]
items.source: MIT News via Center for Data Innovation / CGS Daily Digest

items.title: EngineAI debuts T800 full-scale humanoid robot and PM01 agent at CES 2026
items.summary: EngineAI Robotics Technology showcased its **T800 humanoid robot** and **PM01 general-purpose embodied agent** at CES 2026, positioning them as application-oriented platforms with full-body coordination and fine motor control aimed at real-world human–robot collaboration.[4]
items.source: AI Insider via CGS Daily Digest

items.title: Hexagon Robotics and Microsoft partner on production-ready humanoid systems for factories
items.summary: Hexagon Robotics announced a strategic partnership with Microsoft to build **humanoid robots for data-driven manufacturing**, combining imitation and reinforcement learning with multimodal vision-language-action models on Azure-based cloud and edge infrastructure.[4]
items.source: AI Insider via CGS Daily Digest

items.title: LMArena raises $150M to scale AI model evaluation platform
items.summary: AI evaluation startup **LMArena** secured **$150 million** in funding at a **$1.7 billion** valuation to expand its platform that benchmarks and stress-tests language models using feedback from over 5 million monthly users, aiming to become a trusted standard for real-world AI evaluation.[4]
items.source: AI Insider via CGS Daily Digest

items.title: Deep Delta Learning and Falcon-H1R push new frontiers in efficient reasoning models
items.summary: A recent AI bulletin highlighted **Deep Delta Learning**, a neural architecture that generalizes residual networks with a scalar gate, and **Falcon-H1R**, a 7B-parameter reasoning-optimized model that rivals models up to seven times larger on reasoning benchmarks while improving token efficiency and inference speed.[1]

items.title: DeepSeek proposes Manifold-Constrained Hyper-Connections to stabilize large transformers
items.summary: DeepSeek researchers introduced **Manifold-Constrained Hyper-Connections (mHC)**, an architectural change for multi-lane residual networks in large transformers that dramatically reduces worst-case gradient amplification—from about 3000 to around 1.6—promising more stable and scalable training.[1][2]
items.source: Radical Data Science / AI Updates Weekly (YouTube)

items.title: Physical AI stack advances with Alpamayo 1 VLA and AlpaSim simulator for autonomous driving
items.summary: New work on ‘physical AI’ unveiled **Alpamayo 1**, a 10B-parameter vision-language-action model that outputs driving trajectories with reasoning traces, alongside **AlpaSim**, an open-source closed-loop simulator and over 1,700 hours of real-world driving data to distill safer, smaller deployable driving policies.[1]

items.title: OpenAI expands ChatGPT into health guidance with data-driven virtual nurse concept
items.summary: A weekly AI industry review reports that OpenAI is extending **ChatGPT into health**, proposing a service trained on users’ health data to provide an advice-nurse–style experience, illustrating big tech’s push to prove concrete value in high-stakes domains like healthcare.[1][5]
items.source: Micro Center News / Radical Data Science

items.title: AI-powered humanoid and service robots dominate CES 2026 consumer tech narrative
items.summary: Coverage of CES 2026 highlights a surge of **AI-driven physical systems**, from humanoid companions for older adults to AI-powered home chefs, smart beds, and assistive devices, underscoring a shift from purely digital AI to pervasive physical and consumer-facing embodiments.[6][8][9]
items.source: The Philippine Star / The Economic Times / The Register

items.title: AI-led industrial and scientific advances span humanoid factory workers and neuromorphic HPC
items.summary: Recent data and AI news recap Boston Dynamics’ humanoid factory robot that learns tasks by watching humans, plus a Sandia National Laboratories algorithm that uses neuromorphic hardware to solve fluid dynamics equations far more efficiently than conventional supercomputers, illustrating AI’s growing role in robotics and high-performance computing.[3]

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
